recipe.ingredients: - eggs: 4 large - spinach: 1 cup (fresh) - cherry tomatoes: 1/2 cup (halved) - feta cheese: 1/4 cup (crumbled) - black olives (sliced): 1/4 cup - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/8 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prep Ingredients: Wash and chop the spinach. Halve the cherry tomatoes and slice the black olives. 2. Heat Skillet: In a non-stick skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. 3. Cook Eggs: In a bowl, whisk the eggs with salt and pepper. Pour into the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes until the edges begin to set. 4. Add Veggies and Cheese: Sprinkle the spinach, cherry tomatoes, black olives, and feta cheese over half of the omelette. 5. Fold and Cook: Fold the omelette in half over the filling. Continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes, or until the eggs are fully set. 6. Serve: Carefully slide the omelette onto a plate and serve hot.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 10g, Dietary Fiber: 3g, Sodium: 620mg, Saturated Fat: 5g, Total Fat: 23g, Protein: 22g, Cholesterol: 390mg, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 560 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Eggs: 286 calories for 4 large eggs Spinach: 7 calories per cup Cherry Tomatoes: 16 calories per 1/2 cup Feta Cheese: 80 calories per 1/4 cup Black Olives: 40 calories per 1/4 cup Olive Oil: 119 calories per tablespoon Salt, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 2
